ColumnA: Rights of people affected by TB

ColumnB: The right to life.
The right to be treated with dignity and respect.
The right to the highest attainable standard of physical and mental health (right to health).
The right to freedom from torture and other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
The right to equality and freedom from discrimination.
The right to liberty and security of person.
The right to freedom of movement.
The right to privacy and family life.
The right to confidentiality.
The right to information.
The right to informed consent.
The right to education.
The right to work.
The right to adequate food.
The right to housing.
The right to water and sanitation.
The right to social security.
The right to freedom of expression.
The right to freedom of assembly and association.
The right to participation .
The right to justice and due process.
The right to enjoy the benefits of scientific progress (right to science).
State obligations under international and regional human rights law.
Non-state actor responsibilities under international and regional human rights law.
